name: Puttu
description: Steamed rice flour and coconut cylinders, a traditional Kerala breakfast.
instructions: Roast rice flour lightly if using store-bought
Add salt and sprinkle water to make crumbly texture
Layer rice flour and coconut in puttu maker
Start with coconut, then rice flour, alternate
End with coconut layer on top
Steam for 10 minutes
Remove carefully onto plate
Serve hot with banana, kadala curry, or sugar

name: Pesarattu
description: Green gram crepes from Andhra Pradesh, healthy and protein-rich.
instructions: Soak green gram for 4-6 hours
Grind with green chilies, ginger, cumin to coarse batter
Add salt and curry leaves
Heat dosa pan, pour batter and spread
Sprinkle chopped onions on top
Drizzle oil around edges
Cook until crispy and golden
Serve hot with ginger chutney or upma

name: Andhra Chicken Curry
description: Fiery red chicken curry from Andhra Pradesh with bold spices.
instructions: Heat oil, add curry leaves and onions
Saut√© until golden brown
Add ginger-garlic paste and fry
Add tomatoes and cook until soft
Add all spice powders and fry well
Add chicken pieces and coat with masala
Add salt and 1 cup water
Cover and cook until chicken is tender
Simmer until gravy thickens
Garnish with coriander leaves
Serve hot with rice or roti

name: Mutton Chukka
description: Dry mutton preparation with roasted spices, a Tamil Nadu delicacy.
instructions: Dry roast coriander, fennel, chilies, pepper, cinnamon, and cloves
Grind to fine powder
Pressure cook mutton with salt and turmeric until tender
Heat oil, add curry leaves and onions, fry until golden
Add ginger-garlic paste and fry
Add tomatoes and cook until mushy
Add ground spice powder and fry well
Add cooked mutton and mix well
Cook on high heat until dry and well coated
Serve hot with rice or parotta

name: Kothu Parotta
description: Shredded parotta stir-fried with vegetables, eggs, and meat.
ingredients: 200g chicken or mutton, cooked and shredded
instructions: Heat oil, add curry leaves and onions
Saut√© until golden
Add ginger-garlic paste and green chilies
Add tomatoes and cook until soft
Add cooked meat and spices, mix well
Push to side, scramble eggs
Add shredded parotta
Mix everything together using flat spatulas
Chop and mix continuously for 5 minutes
Garnish with coriander
Serve hot with raita

name: Masala Vada
description: Crispy lentil fritters with onions and spices, perfect tea-time snack.
instructions: Soak chana dal for 2 hours, drain completely
Grind coarsely without adding water
Add onions, green chilies, ginger, curry leaves
Add fennel, asafoetida, coriander leaves, and salt
Mix well
Heat oil for deep frying
Take small portions, flatten slightly, and slide into oil
Fry on medium heat until golden brown
Drain excess oil
Serve hot with coconut chutney

name: Murukku
description: Crunchy spiral-shaped rice flour snack, a festival favorite.
instructions: Mix rice flour, urad dal flour, cumin, sesame, asafoetida, and salt
Add melted butter and mix
Add water gradually to make stiff dough
Fill murukku press with dough
Heat oil for deep frying
Press murukku directly into hot oil in spiral shape
Fry until golden brown
Drain excess oil
Cool completely and store in airtight container

name: Banana Chips
description: Crispy fried banana slices, a Kerala specialty.
instructions: Peel raw bananas and slice thinly using slicer
Mix turmeric and salt in water
Soak banana slices in this water for 10 minutes
Heat oil for deep frying
Drain banana slices and pat dry
Fry in batches until golden and crispy
Drain excess oil on paper towels
Cool completely
Store in airtight container

name: Nei Appam
description: Sweet ghee-fried appam with jaggery and coconut filling.
instructions: Mix jaggery with coconut and cardamom for filling
Mix rice flour, wheat flour, mashed banana, and salt
Add water to make thick batter
Heat paniyaram pan, add little ghee in each mould
Pour batter half-way
Add jaggery-coconut filling
Cover with more batter
Cook on low heat until golden on both sides
Serve warm

name: Kozhukattai
description: Steamed rice flour dumplings with sweet coconut-jaggery filling.
instructions: Boil water with salt and ghee
Add rice flour, mix quickly to form dough
Cover and let it cool
Mix coconut, jaggery, and cardamom for filling
Knead dough well until smooth
Make small balls, flatten into cups
Fill with coconut-jaggery mixture
Seal edges and shape into dumplings
Steam for 15 minutes
Serve warm with ghee
